H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H175.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}; brother of {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► first high {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

71.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H171.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ahisamach<SDBH:אֲחִיסָמָךְ>}; tribe of {L:Dan<SDBH:דָּן>}; ► craftsman working on tabernacle

H1835.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fifth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Bilhah<SDBH:בִּלְהָה>}, slave of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H2796.def: = person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H7551.def: = person whose profession it is to sew decorative patterns into cloth

H8504.def: = woven material, dyed reddish-purple with a substance obtained from the murex shellfish

H4399.def: = an activity involving a physical effort and usually requiring a certain amount of training or skill

H4345.def: = a frame with a fine meshwork, ◄ made of bronze, ► probably intended to hold the burning coals and allow the ashes and grease to fall through to the ground, as well as to allow for a draft of air to pass through from underneath; there were four bronze {L:rings<SDBH:טַבַּעַת>} on the four upper corners of the grating. and {L:poles<SDBH:בַּד>} were inserted through these rings for transporting the altar
